alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 2:22PM EDT until March 26 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR LAMAR COUNTY... At 222 PM EDT, While the heavy rain has ended, local law enforcement continues to report several roads closed due to water flowing. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since 8 AM. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and expected to continue. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barnesville, Milner, Aldora, Goggins, Johnstonville, Redbone and Piedmont. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
